summary: This is an email chain from January 2019 regarding maintenance issues with security cameras at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The Acting Facility Manager discusses problems with down cameras, including one in the Medical Waiting Area, and mentions waiting on a vendor to fulfill equipment for a camera replacement and upgrade project.

persons.name: G CESCO
persons.context: The sender of the email, identified as the Acting Facility Manager at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, discussing camera maintenance issues and vendor follow-up.

events.title: Email about MCC camera maintenance
events.description: An email chain discusses ongoing issues with down security cameras at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, including a specific camera in the Medical Waiting Area, and mentions a pending vendor equipment delivery for a camera upgrade project.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 20007
keyFacts: The document is an internal Bureau of Prisons email from January 4, 2019, concerning security camera maintenance at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.
It specifically notes that Camera #76 for the Medical Waiting Area had a 'Communication Problem' as of January 3, 2019.
The email indicates a broader camera project was underway to replace existing cameras and add new ones, but the vendor had not yet fulfilled the equipment portion.
The correspondence highlights routine facility management operations at the MCC, the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was later held and died.
